location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bowyear, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, John Sebastian Natter, to Dymock Lyster and George Skipp, East India Company factors at Bussora [Bushire]

mods.abstract: The letter is cover for a shipment of woollens aboard the Defianceand gives reasons for recent poor sales. Also given is the news that the Khan's army has not yet left Schyrass [Shiraz], due to the caution of the Hallaw [Hula] and Julfar [QawƒÅsim] Arabs in lending their gallivats to his cause.
